title: 111_hr3705
content: The "Expand School Meals Act of 2009" may be cited as the Act. It addresses free lunch eligibility. The "Expand School Meals Act of 2009" is amending the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act to change the income eligibility guidelines for free lunches from 130 percent to 185 percent. The "Expand School Meals Act of 2009" amends the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act by changing income eligibility guidelines for free lunches from 130 percent to 185 percent. Amendments include revisions to frequency and amount of revisions in the Act. Conforming amendments are made to Section 9 of the Act. The "Expand School Meals Act of 2009" amends the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act by changing income eligibility guidelines for free lunches to 185 percent. Amendments include revisions to frequency and amount of revisions in the Act. Conforming amendments are made to Section 9 of the Act, including changes to the wording regarding free or reduced-price lunches. The "Expand School Meals Act of 2009" modifies income eligibility guidelines for free lunches to 185 percent and makes amendments to the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act. This includes changes to clauses (ii) and (iii) and redesignating clauses (iv) and (v) in paragraph (7). In paragraph (7), amendments are made to the heading and wording related to meals policy. In paragraph (9), changes are made to the heading and subparagraph (B). In amendments to the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act, changes are made to various subsections including the removal of references to reduced price lunches and costs. The Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1759a) is amended in subsection (a) to remove references to reduced price lunches and costs. The Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1759a) is amended to remove references to reduced price lunches and costs. This includes striking specific mentions of reduced price lunches in various clauses. The Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1759a) is amended to remove references to reduced price lunches and costs, including specific mentions of reduced price lunches in various clauses. Section 12(l)(4) and Section 13 of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act are amended to remove references to reduced price lunches and costs. This includes striking specific mentions of reduced price lunches in various clauses and redesignating subparagraphs. Section 17 of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act is amended to remove references to reduced price lunches. This includes striking specific mentions of reduced price lunches in various clauses and subsections. The Expand School Meals Act of 2009 amends Section 17 of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act by removing references to reduced price lunches and inserting new guidelines for eligibility determinations for free and reduced price meals. The Expand School Meals Act of 2009 amends Section 17 of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act by removing references to reduced price meals and updating eligibility guidelines for free and reduced price meals. The Expand School Meals Act of 2009 further amends the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act by removing references to reduced price meals in various sections. The Secretary of Agriculture will implement changes to the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act regarding reduced price meals according to established transition rules. SEC. 3. FREE BREAKFAST ELIGIBILITY. Section 4 of the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 is amended to remove references to reduced price breakfasts and streamline certain provisions. Section 4 of the Child Nutrition Act of 1966 is amended to remove references to reduced price breakfasts and streamline certain provisions by updating the language to refer to "meals" instead. The Child Nutrition Act of 1966 is amended to remove references to reduced price meals and update language to refer to "meals" instead. Conforming amendments are made throughout the Act to remove mentions of reduced price.
